page.title: 11 CONTRASTING LAND-USES (1)
page.content: {A Walk along " Park Lug" from G.R. SU {539157 to SU 536170. } Park Lug is an ancient field boundary, possibly related to the Village of Bihop's Waltham and the Palace of the Bishop of Winchester located there. Today it a very marked feature on the landscape comprising a broad ditch flanked by a line of trees. It also marks an interesting line between two contrasting farming types. East of the Lug, most of the hedgerows shown on the 1973 OS map still exist. Many of the fields are therefore small , and mainly grassed - not always free of weeds. Beef farming dominates. West of the Lug, even the few hedges marked on the O.S. map have gone and the copse at G.R.535165 has been much reduced. Arable farming is the system in use with large fields of oil-seed rape and cereals dominating the scene.
